laboratory_examinations.findings: The scale showed a 59% improvement by the end of the course of ECT.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement observed by the second and third ECT treatments was sustained throughout the remainder of the six ECT treatments.

laboratory_examinations.findings: The scale showed a 40% improvement by the end of the course of ECT.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement observed by the second and third ECT treatments was sustained throughout the remainder of the six ECT treatments.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Baseline score indicated severe depression; no major change until the fifth ECT, at which time the patient no longer scored in the depressed range.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Score remained at this level through the sixth ECT.

laboratory_examinations.findings: There was a 66% increase from baseline to the measurement following the sixth ECT.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The area changed progressively following the first ECT, while the time taken to complete samples initially increased but then decreased below baseline through the remainder of the ECT period.
